question:

$$\begin{cases}
3x & + & 2y & - & z & + & 2t & = & 1\\
x & - & y & + &2 z & - & 4t & = & -1\\
-x & - & 2y & - & z & + & t & = & 0\\
2x & + & 3y & - & 2z & + & t & = & 2
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has a unique solution.
answer3: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.

question:
Consider the points $A =(1, 2, 3)$, $B =(2, 3, -1)$ and $C =(3, 4, 0)$ of $\mathbb{R}^3$. 
Choose the correct answer:
answer1: The $ABC$ plane has equation $x-y+1=0$ and $D=(4, 5, 6)$ belongs to $ABC$.
answer2: The $ABC$ plane has equation $x+y+1=0$ and $D=(4, -5, 7)$ belongs to $ABC$.
answer3: The $ABC$ plane has equation $2x-y+3=0$ and $D=(2, 7, 6)$ belongs to $ABC$.
answer4: The $ABC$ plane has equation $2x+y+3=0$ and $D=(-1, -1, 0)$ belongs to $ABC$.

question:

answer4: $P^A_B$ is not always invertible, and if so, $P^B_A = P^A_B$

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & - & y & + & 2z & - & 3t & = & 1 \\ 
2x & + & y & - & 2z & - & t & = & 2 \\ 
x &- &3y &+ &z &- &2t &= &-1 \\
  &   &      &     &z &- &t &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(5,\,1,\,3,\,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(5+20y,\,y,\,-10-13y,\,8+15y\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(5,0,-10,8\right)$ as its unique solution.

The authorities of the city want to predict the price $y$ of a house, depending on its environment. The environment value $x$ is estimated by a special complex index. In this situation, identify the correct interpretation of the coefficients in the fitted regression line $\hat{y} = 200000+30000x$.
answer1: The slope is equal to $30 000$ and implies that for every unit increase in the environment index the mean value of the house price is estimated to increase by $30 000$ units.
answer2: The slope of $30 000$ implies that for every unit increase in house price, the mean value of the environment index is estimated to increase by $30 000$ units.
answer3: The y-intercept implies that the estimated mean price of a house is equal to $30 000$ units when the index of the environment is equal to $0$ units.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
6x & - & 11y & + & 2z & - & 9t & = & 2 \\
2x & + & y & - & 2z & - & t & = & 1 \\
x & - & 3y & + & z & - & 2t & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(0,\,1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(1+z,\,0,\,z,\,-z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(1-y,\,y,\,2+y,\,-y\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & - & z & - & t & = & 1\\
x & - & 2y & + & 3z & + & t &  = & 1\\
x & - & y & + & 3z & + & t & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1-z,\,0,\,z,\,-2z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,0,\,0,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(1-z,\,0,\,z,\,-2z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}\setminus\{0\}$.

How many solutions does the following linear system has?
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 2y & = & 4 \\
x & - & 2y & = & 0 \\
4x & + & 3y & = & 12
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(2,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(\frac{24}{11},\,\frac{12}{11}\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has an infinite number of solutions of the form $\left(2y,\,y\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

question: Consider $x^3+5=9x$. Find $x_3$ using Newton's method considering $x_0=2.75$.

A lake has 780 frogs. In the absence of predators, the frog population grows by 15% each month. However, if there are predators, 90 frogs are lost each month.

Give a recurrence relation for the population of frogs after n months, admitting the existence of  predators.
(consider ??, the floor function).

Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{C}^2\right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
(1+i)z& + & (1-i)w & = & i \\
(1-i)z& + & (1+i)w & = & 1-i
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The unique solution of the linear system is $\bigg(\frac{3+i}{4},-\frac{1+i}{4}\bigg)$.
answer2: The solutions of the linear system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{1+i}{4},\frac{-1+i}{4}+z\bigg)$, for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer3: The linear system has no solutions.
answer4: The linear system has the vector $(i,-i)$ has its unique solution.

question: Find the flux of $\textbf{F}$ across S, where $\displaystyle\textbf{F}(x,y,z)=x\textbf{i}+2y\textbf{j}+3z\textbf{k}\,$, where S is the cube with vertices $\displaystyle(\pm 1, \pm 1, \pm 1)$.

A researcher studies the wind speed in a particular city. A sample of two hundred observations was recorded. The mean speed was calculated to be $10 m/s$ and the median speed was calculated to be $7 m/s$. Which of the following interpretations is correct?
answer1: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was less than or equal to $7 m/s$.
answer2: The most frequently occurring wind speed in the sample was $7 m/s$.
answer3: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was equal to $7 m/s$.
answer4: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was less than or equal to $10 m/s$.

How many solutions does the following linear system have, with respect to $a\in\mathbb{R}$?
$$\left\{\begin{array}{cccccccc}
ax & + & y & + & 2az & = & a+5\\
ax & - & ay & - & z & = & a\\
x & - & ay & + & z & = & 3
\end{array}\right.$$
answer1: One solution for $a\neq 1$, and no solutions for $a=1$.
answer2: One solution for $a\neq 1,-1$, no solutions for $a=1$ and infinitely many solutions for $a=-1$.
answer4: No solutions for $a\neq 0$, and one solution for $a=0$.
